I am doing the JIRA tutorial for Atlassian Devlopers and I have installed the SDK from this location: 
https://developer.atlassian.com/docs/getting-started/set-up-the-atlassian-plugin-sdk-and-build-a-project/install-the-atlassian-sdk-on-a-windows-system

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When running the Sprint Report, the active sprint is not displayed as the default one and instead it's showing a closed sprint report by default.

On the Burnout report, the active sprint is displayed properly as the default one. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board;
# Create a sprint (Sprint 1) and add issues to it;
# Close the sprint (Sprint 1);
# Create a new sprint (Sprint 2) and add issues to it;
# Go to reports and select Sprint Report.

h3. Expected Results
* To have the Sprint Report displayed for Sprint 2 by default.


h3. Actual Results
* The Sprint Report displays the Sprint 1 as the default one instead Sprint 2.


h3. Notes
* The same issue is not replicable when using JIRA Software 7.0.5 or 7.0.10;


h3.Solution / Workaround
* Manually select the active sprint on the dropdown menu.
fields.summary: Sprint Report is not showing the active sprint as the default one

2016-05-26 17:05:18,258 http-nio-8701-exec-7 DEBUG admin 1025x162x1 13ygvi5 10.60.2.136 /secure/admin/IndexAdmin.jspa [c.a.j.issue.index.IndexConsistencyUtils] isIndexConsistent: Comment: expectedCount=24; actualCount=24

fields.description:
h3. Summary
For the Epic Status custom field, it has configurable values that you can set by configuring the field in the Custom Fields administration screen:
 !EpicStatusConfig.png|thumbnail!
(!) The field has to be unlocked first as per [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-unlock-a-locked-field-779158866.html]
If you *disable* the last status, e.g. in the example screenshot its *Open*, JIRA Agile will still set Epics to that status when an epic is marked as Done. It disregards the fact that the status has already been disabled.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.3.12 with JIRA Agile 6.7.11
* JIRA 7.1.2 with JIRA Agile 7.1.20

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Unlock the Epic Status field.
# Configure it in the Custom Fields administration screen: 
!EpicStatusConfig.png|thumbnail!
# Create a new status, for example *Open*, and put it as the last status. Disable this status.
# Go to any Agile board, create an epic, and mark the Epic as done:
!MarkAsDone.png|thumbnail!
# Go to the issue navigator and search for the epic.

h3. Expected Results
# The epic's *Epic Status* field is shown as *Done*, which is the last status in the list that isn't disabled.

h3. Actual Results
# The epic's *Epic Status* field has the value *Open*.
 
h3. Notes
JIRA Agile always uses the last status in the list of Epic Status values, regardless of it disabled or not.

h3.Workaround
Move the disabled status up one status, so its no longer the last one.: [^MoveStatus.png]
fields.summary: Marking Epics as done may set its Epic Status to disabled statuses

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have sprints with lots of issues and all of them have multiple subtasks. I have the healthy habit of collapsing all issues that are completely done, to keep an uncluttered overview of the work still to do. JIRA will remember which issues are closed and which are not. So far, so good.

Now something changes in the order of the sprint, like moving an issue up in de order or adding a new issue at the top of the sprint. I know this is not supposed to happen in Scrum during a sprint, but of course it will from time to time. The collapsed / uncollapsed view is now messed up: some previously collapsed issues are now uncollapsed and vice-versa. Of course this is annoying, because I expect all collapsed issues to be done.

I'm a developer myself and did some research to help find & fix the problem. I found that the localStorage entry gh.boardSettings.x has a collapsedSwimLanes property which is an array of numbers. I assume these are issue indices referring to the n'th issue at the sprint board. This would explain why the view gets messed up when you add issues somewhere else than at the bottom of the sprint cause the indices of all 'lower' issues will change.

My suggested solution is to use issue numbers, like JOC-142 instead of indices as entries in the collapsedSwimLanes array. These are unique per JIRA instance and not depending on any order.

Thanks for considering this fix and making an already happy JIRA user even more happy! :)

P.S. I also see numbers higher than the amount of issues on my current sprint, so it seems these are not reset when a new sprint opens and also not during the sprint. When using issue numbers, maybe this should not happen anymore and the whole list should be refreshed every time a change occurs.
fields.summary: Collapsed swim lanes can't handle Sprint issue reordering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13701].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
_View on board_ call (GHGoToBoard.jspa) iterates over all boards the user performing the lookup has access to and executes them one by one to check if given issue belongs to it. So by design _View on board_ performance will degrade with increasing number of boards. This also multiplied by complexity of each Board's JQL. 
 !View_on_board.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Jira with many issues (> 500k)
# Create many board (> 1000)
# Go to _View on board_ link at any issue.  

h3. Expected Results
Call executed with-in 1 minute. It's JScript timeout. 

h3. Actual Results
Call timeouts with *Communications breakdown* error. If you open link in new tab it might take 200 secs. 
 
h3. Notes
None

h3.Workaround
# Increase AJAX calls timeout
#* See https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-change-the-default-ajax-timeout-in-jira-824345485.html 
#* This will work only for middle-side instance. Suggested new timeout value: 120 secs
# If possible, reduce number of boards and their complexity: 
#* Check *scrum boards*. Check the sprint dates for the current/last sprint. If a project is inactive then it is highly likely that sprints have not been planned in the recent few months.
#* Check *kanban board*. Run the created/resolved chart for the filter/project in that kanban board and see. Again, if the project is inactive then not many new issues would had been created in recent past.
#* Check  *empty JQL board*.
#* The list of JQL filters associated with all Boards can be retrieved running below query:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
select rv."ID", rv."NAME", sr.reqcontent from searchrequest sr, "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" rv where rv."SAVED_FILTER_ID" = sr.id;
{code}
# Disable the _View on board_ functionality:
#* Block calls to {{/secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa}} at proxy level, please see example for Apache Httpd:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
RewriteEngine On
RewriteRule ^/secure/GHGoToBoard.jspa - [F]
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA "View on Board" link GHGoToBoard response time degrades with number of boards

fields.description:
To simplify things, we use quick filters on the agile board, thus reducing the number of displayed tasks. One of these filters ({{status != Closed}}) hides completed tasks, i.e. the right-most column "Done" does not display anything if the filter is switched on (thus, leaving the board with tasks in status "To Do" and "In Progress" only).

Now when a task is moved (using drag and drop) into the right-most column "Done" *and* the column already holds a considerable amount of tasks, the task is added at the bottom of this column / story (/) and the agile board scrolls it into view (?). Well, actually it adjusts the vertical view to scroll it into view, but as the filter hides the task, it is not being displayed.

As a result, the task disappears when dropped in the "Done" column (/) and the board scrolls down (x), depending on the number of completed tasks.

Often, the active story (from which the task was picked and moved) is no longer visible afterwards (x) (as it has been scrolled out of view). In other words, the smart "scroll into view" feature does not work well in this situation and confuses our developers and testers. :(

The expectation is that scrolling into view respects filters, i.e. the view does not scroll in case a task that is being moved is not displayed.
fields.summary: Agile board does not respect hidden (filtered) tasks when scrolling into view

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the board filter contains {{project = <projectKey>}}, the sidebar of this board will contains some links associated to the project, for example Releases, Issues, Project shortcuts and Project administration. If the board filter does not contains {{project = <projectKey>}} explicitly, the sidebar will not contains any links for Releases, Issues, Project shortcuts and Project administration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Scrum/Kanban board with sample data.
# View board's configuration, the filter query should be like {{project = SSP ORDER BY Rank ASC}}.  !SSPBoard.PNG|thumbnail! 
# Create a new filter with only issues in To Do and In Progress status from the result returns from the board filter, for example {{filter = "Filter for SSP board" AND status in ("To Do", "In progress")}}.
# Create another board with the new filter from step 3, the configuration of the board should be similar with the configuration in this screenshot.  !newBoard.PNG|thumbnail! 
# Go back to view the board.

h3. Expected Results
The sidebar for the board created in step 4 should be the same as the one in step 1.  !sampleData.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
In JIRA 7.1.x, there are no project specific links in the sidebar for board created in step 4.  !new.PNG|thumbnail!
In JIRA 6.4.x, there is no sidebar at all.
 

h3.Workaround
Add {{AND project = SSP}} at the end of the board filter in step 4
fields.summary: Sidebar not showing project details if project field is not selected explicitly in the board filter

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 !fisheye.JPG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
The FishEye plugin will be shown as *incompatible* when to Check compatibility for update to Jira 7 from Jira 6.3.3 instance

h3. Notes
It appears the marketplace listing is not currently up-to-date, however the plugin is - this error is not valid, and when updating JIRA / JIRA Software the plugin will be compatible.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When upgrading from JIRA 6 with JIRA Agile to JIRA Software 7, using the JIRA Agile license will prompt the following error:

{code}
The license could not be installed.

This license is invalid. Please double-check that you have entered it correctly, and contact Support if the issue continues.
{code}

This does not provide any information, as that the JIRA Server license should be used instead of the JIRA Agile one.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be nice if the error could direct to a KB page explaining which licenses are to be used when upgrading from JIRA 6 to JIRA 7.

h3. Workaround 

As of now, the workaround for this is to open a issue in Atlassian Support with our CA team or with the JIRA support for clarification on which license to use.
fields.summary: License error when upgrading from JIRA 6 to JIRA 7

fields.description:
*Step 1*
We have JIRA and Crucible projects with those prefixes:
Crucible: "MAYA"
JIRA: "VMAYA"

*Step 2*
Crucible project is fed with commits via FishEye from our own GIT server.

*Step 3*
When we push in GIT commit that have message related to both Crucible and JIRA something like:
{quote}VMAYA-7500 #resolve Something
@review MAYA-655{quote}

*End result*
JIRA issue *+VMAYA+*-655 get related commits and make a transition, but it has nothing to do with this commit that should be related only to VMAYA-7500 issue!

May be the problem is in smart commit regex. It should not match "MAYA-655" in "VMAYA-655". I think that it will be good if it expect "empty space" or beginning of a line before matching issue id.
fields.summary: Smart commits match any text, like "MAYA-655" matches "VMAYA-655"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13636].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of [JIRA Software 7.1|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARE/JIRA+Software+7.1.x+release+notes], when completing a Sprint, a popup will appear allowing the Admin to choose a Destination for Incomplete Issues if there are Sprints Scheduled.  By Default, the Backlog is Selected; in previous versions of JIRA Software (Agile), incomplete issues will be returned to the top of the backlog.
 !J64_backlog.png|thumbnail! 
Current behavior: If you complete a sprint and then return all incomplete issues to the backlog then they will return to the location in the backlog they were before the sprint started. This means if you dragged them from the bottom (if you just created them for example) then they'll return to the bottom.
 !J71_backlog.png|thumbnail! 

See related: [Completing a sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER071/Completing+a+sprint]

h3. Suggested Solution

Issues should always return to the top of the backlog, as they were just included in a sprint it should be assumed that they are a high priority and they should appear at the top of the backlog instead of their previous version.
 
h3. Workaround
* Drag issues to the top of the backlog before adding them to your sprint.
* Create a future sprint and move incomplete issue there before closing the current sprint.
fields.summary: When a sprint is completed incomplete issues should return to the top of the backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13632].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

* When browsing to 'Manage Boards' it's possible the 1min Ajax timeout in JIRA kicks in, preventing the board from loading. This will result in a timeout as per the attached screenshot.
* Additionally, when accessing the Rapid Boards for certain projects the page load times can be excessive.
* Please note there is another more specific bug related to slow _All Boards_: [JIRA Software Viewing All Boards can timeout due to resolving project list for each loaded board - JSW-15295|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-15295]

h3. Environment

Reproduced with the following instance size:

{noformat}
    ___ Database Statistics ____________________

         Issues                                        : 330776
         Projects                                      : 187
         Custom Fields                                 : 180
         Workflows                                     : 306
         Users                                         : 3719
         Groups                                        : 2060
         Attachments                                   : 118585
         Comments                                      : 265597
{noformat}

It could be:
* 52 Rapid Boards were using the {{issue in parent()}} function
* Large number of boards and/or complex JQL used in the board filters.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Use a large instance, such as above.
# Install a third-party plugin that provides additional functionality. This was reproduced with J-Tricks, using {{issue in parent()}}.
# Access the Manage Boards page, or browse to projects.

It is important to note that this affected rapid boards which did *not* use that third-party JQL, as {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.sidebar.AgileBoardScopeFilterContextProvider.getContext}} (the JIRA Software code called from the JIRA Core sidebar) executes the same code to perform project lookups by analysing JQL queries (analysing, not executing). The problem is due to the way the third-party plugin is designed is that the operand executes when it's analysed. Specifically this is not conclusively caused by third-party plugins.

h3. Expected Results

* The Manage Boards page does not time out, and the project page loads within an acceptable time.
* Viewing Rapid Boards responds in a reasonable time frame.

h3. Actual Results

The ajax timeout kicks in and the page times out whilst waiting for {{rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/viewsData}} to return results, or the board can take > 1 minute to load.

h3. Notes

Accessing that endpoint outside of JIRA (and thus bypassing ajax) in this instance returned within 1.2mins.

This appears to be caused by {{QueryToProjectMapper.getProjectContextIdsForQuery}} which uses JIRA Core code to lookup the QueryContext. Due to the way the lookup occurs it's possible that JQL may be executed and this times out the board.

A sample snapshot of the problem has been attached.

h3. Verification

The problem occurs in multiple areas of JIRA Software - it's most evident in manage boards however can occur on the Rapid Boards. 

For Manage Boards:
# Call {{/rest/greenhopper/1.0/rapidviews/viewsData}} will be slow (40+ seconds, in some cases will not return anything as the AJAX timeout terminates the request).
# Class {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource.getViewsAndConfigModel}} will be present in the stacktrace for long-running threads: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
"http-nio-80-exec-45" #8007 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x000000003cac0000 nid=0x19dc runnable [0x000000027765a000]
...
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewProjectHelper.getRapidViewProjectList(RapidViewProjectHelper.java:58)
...
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListHelper.buildListAndConfigModel(RapidViewListHelper.java:105)
...
        at com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewListResource.getViewsAndConfigModel(RapidViewListResource.java:74)
...
{code}

For Rapid Boards:
# Many threads will be waiting on a response to {{AbstractFuture$Sync}} as per the attached screenshot. These threads are waiting on the populattion of the cache that {{FieldPossibleValues.getProjectIdsForQuery}} queries.
# There will be one executing thread in {{QueryToProjectMapper$RapidViewCacheLoader.load}}, populating the cache. Below is a sample stack trace:
{noformat}
"http-bio-8081-exec-862 uri:/plugins/servlet/projects/ABC username:captain.planet" #1247 daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007f210832f000 nid=0x1aca waiting on condition [0x00007f1cea179000]

{noformat}
(i) Once the above thread has finished executing, the cache will be populated and all other threads that are waiting on it to be available will finish execution.


h3. Workaround
Disable the plugin that is causing the problem (this can be identified by using something such as jProfiler to profile the instance as per [Using jProfiler to analyse a JIRA application performance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/using-jprofiler-to-analyse-a-jira-application-performance-355926726.html]).

Alternatively, you can increase the timeout as mentioned in [How to change the default AJAX timeout in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+change+the+default+AJAX+timeout+in+JIRA].

h3. Note on fix
This ticket is a combination of a couple of different problems related to JQL and Boards:
* Some of them fixed: JSWSERVER-15295, JSWSERVER-15663
* Or largely mitigated by JRASERVER-67570.
* there is feature request which potentially helps further JRASERVER-60957, we will monitor the traction. 

We believe that the current problem is resolved at this point.
fields.summary: JIRA Software Manage Boards and viewing boards can timeout due to analysing JQL

fields.description:
When you have a board configured such that there are multiple workflow statuses in a column, when you drag a card from the board to that column, it will display the different statuses available for that column so that you can choose the appropriate one.

When you then set up swimlanes and there is a swimlane beneath the swimlane that your card is in, when you move the card the grey area of the swimlane below hides one or more options for the column that you want to drag the card to.

Expected functionality would be that the swimlane below would move further down the page so as to not obscure the options for the column that I'm dragging the card to.
fields.summary: Swimlanes block visibility of workflow statuses on boards

fields.description:
We use Jira Agile with the following setup:
* We have multiple teams, this is represented by a custom "Team" field in each issue type in each project.
* Subtasks do not have that field, as their parent issue already has a Team.
* Each team has their own board.
* In the board we want to include all the issues that have the according "Team" value set + *all according subtasks*.

The subtask part is the important one here.

We solved that issue by using the Jira Labs Search Intent Plugin, which is just made for that use case:
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-search-intent-plugin/server/overview

As the Plugin is unsupported now, I'd like to suggest to add the functionality of the plugin directly to Jira Software.

Whenever Subtasks should be included in a board, dependent of whether the parent issue is included, this functionality is needed.
fields.summary: Integrate Search Intent Plugin

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the current release of JIRA Software in Cloud, users are able to change/edit story points after a sprint is started when viewed on the scrum board. This should not be the case.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software Cloud Version {{1000.5.2}}
* JIRA Agile version {{1000.0.1-D20160421T051057}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a test issue in a scrum project.
# Create a sprint and add the test issue created in Step 1 to the sprint.
# Insert a numeric value for the field *Estimate*.
# Start the sprint.
# Click on the test issue in the sprint and try to edit the field *Estimate*.

h3. Expected Results
Unable to edit the field *Estimate*.

h3. Actual Results
Able to edit the field *Estimate*.
 
h3. Notes
* Currently, the issue does not affect JIRA Server {{7.1.6}}.

* The ability to change story points after a sprint is started creates discrepancy between planning of a sprint and and the retrospective process.

* As per the documentation on planning sprints, story points should not be changed after a sprint is started:
** https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Estimate+in+story+points

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Able to edit estimated story points after sprint has started when issue viewed on scrum board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the card color configuration page for a board, if an user define colors based on JQL queries, write an invalid query and save the configurations, the board will not show any card colors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new board
# Set card colors based on JQL queries
# Among the queries, put an invalid one

h3. Expected Results
JIRA would still show the card colors for the correct queries and/or ultimately not allow an invalid query to be saved in the board configurations.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA will not show any card color in the board. In the card color configuration page, the JQL query field will show the (x) icon while editing the field, but will still allow to save the incorrect query

h3.Workaround
Finding and correcting the problematic query will bring back the card colors to the board.
fields.summary: Card color will not work at all in a board if there is an invalid JQL

fields.description:
*Summary*
Velocity Chart in an Agile board showing sprints that should be excluded based on the filter that runs the board

*Environment*
JIRA software 7.1.2 with jira agile 7.1.20

*Steps to Reproduce*
# create new software project "project1"
# create issue with 2 labels (label1, label2) in that project
# remove label2 from issue
# create board "board for label1" with jql "project = project1 and labels in (label1) ORDER BY Rank ASC"
# create board "board for label2" with jql "project = project1 and labels in (label2) ORDER BY Rank ASC"
# in "board for label1" create new sprint "sprint for label1 - sprint1" and include issue.
# start "sprint for label1 - sprint1", end sprint
# alter issue - remove label1, add label2
# in "board for label2" create new sprint "sprint for label2 - sprint1" and include issue.
# start "sprint for label2 - sprint1", end sprint
# go to the velocity chart for "sprint for label2 - sprint1"
 
*Basically it means that the velocity chart will include all previous sprints that the issues matching the board JQL was assigned to.*


*Expected Results*
there should be only visible sprint "sprint for label2 - sprint1" that does match the board jql

*Actual Results*
2 sprints are visible "sprint for label1 - sprint1" that does not match the board jql and 
proper "sprint for label2 - sprint1" that does match the board jql

*Notes*
None

*Workaround*
None
fields.summary: Velocity Chart in an Agile board showing sprints that should be excluded based on the filter that runs the board

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, if a user navigates to the Default Field Configuration after it has been modified and selects the "Restore Defaults" option at the top, system fields such as 'Epic Name' will lose the Required tag next to their names, even if they are still required system fields. This causes confusion.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to the Default Field Configuration under the Field Configurations menu

*Problem Definition*

Currently for Software (Agile) reporting, (Velocity Chat for example) JIRA will be showing result based on last updated sprint. For example is there are 3 sprints each for 3 teams, JIRA will be combining last 6 updated sprint irrelevant to the teams.

This will be problematic when user is using parallel sprint and would like JIRA to report result from specific Sprints.

*Suggested Solution*

User can create different boards for different team to track the sprints.

JIRA - 6.4.12, 7.1.2 
Bitbucket Server/Stash - 3.11.11, 4.5.1

2016-04-28 10:09:45,893 JIRA-EventThread-16 WARN anonymous 609x8737x1 eq8x5y 127.0.0.1,127.0.0.1 /rest/remote-event-consumer/latest/events/JiraBranchEvent [devstatus.triggers.workflow.IssueTransitionHistoryServiceImpl] registerIssueTransitionedByEvent() has errors for eventId branch:sha1:d830e7d9dc8b5790494b845427241c629e1cc2d1 : [You do not have permission to browse issues in this project.]
{noformat}

h3. Summary
The pop-up dialog box for Assign and Comment are in different sizes depending on where it is displayed.

h3. Environment
JIRA Software 7.1.4 (Server)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a JIRA Software project, create a board
# Select any issue in the board and open the Assign or Comment window
# The Assign/Comment window is 540 pixels wide
# In a JIRA core project, go to issue navigator
# Select any issue in the issue navigator and open the Assign or Comment window
# The Assign/Comment window is 810 pixels wide

h3. Expected Results
Assign/Comment window in JIRA Software board should be the same size as the one shown in issue navigator.

h3. Actual Results
Assign/Comment window opened in JIRA Software board is smaller size (540 pixels) compared to the ones opened in JIRA Core issue navigator (810 pixels)

It should at least 810 pixels wide as 540 pixels wide looks really small and makes it difficult to view/edit longer comments in the description box. Is there any reason why it is designed this way?
 
h3.Workaround
# Override element.style in the *JIRA Adminstration > System > Announcement Banner*: [How to Change the Assign/Comment Dialog Box Width in JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=824153674]
# or Change the Dialog.WIDTH_PRESETS sizes in [JIRA Install|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/important-directories-and-files-189891075.html#ImportantDirectoriesandFiles-JIRAInstallationDirectory]/atlassian-jira/includes/jira/dialog/Dialog-min.js

fields.description:
Our department has recently switched from another ticket system to using the JIRA ticket system software.

For the most part it is really good.  We are having lots of problems though with communication and notifications.

The biggest problem is the way that tickets are sent to people.  We are not JIRA Administrators so we cannot make global changes so we need to make changes as JIRA users.

On other systems, we could choose which ticket groups we wanted to get emails for, but it appears in JIRA we have to be watchers on a ticket in order to get emails.

The problem with this is we have to know about the ticket before we can become a watcher and then even if we know about the ticket we have to logon and do some clicks to become a watcher.

So we would like to be able to automatically be watchers of all new tickets in an Instance, but then be able to opt out of the emails for certain components.  So if an instance has components A,B,C, by default we would become auto-watchers of any tickets in the instance that are assigned to A,B, and C.  User 1 is fine with this because he watches all components.  User 2 though only needs all emails related to component C so they would like to opt out of components A and B.

And we need the ability to set all this up from a User level and not have to bother Administrators or do any kind of extra workarounds and inventive schemes to make this happen.

I would like to talk to somebody at Atlassian further about this issue and see what kind of suggestions can be made.  Or perhaps there is a different way to use the software to accomplish the same feature.
fields.summary: Auto Watch Capability for Components in Instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In [this page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/advanced-searching-functions-338363497.html#AdvancedSearchingFunctions-latestReleasedVersion%28%29], we can see that the latestReleasedVersion() only supports the *IN* and *NOT IN* operators. However, the example given in the documentation uses the *=* operator.

When testing in JIRA 7.1.4, it looks like latestReleasedVersion() supports *=* and *!=*. When trying with *IN* and *NOT IN*, it doesn't work.

h3. Suggestion
The supported operators and example should be tested and documentation should be updated to what is really supported. The following documentation should also be updated to reflect this
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver071/advanced-searching-fields-reference-802172572.html
fields.summary: latestReleasedVersion() in Advance Searching documentation is inconsistent

fields.description:
*Summary:*
Users are not able to reopen a sprint when its original board does not exist anymore (with or without tickets on it).

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a Scrum board/project
# Start a sprint ("Sprint A")
# Delete/Remove all tickets from this sprint
# Delete the board/project
# Create another board/project
# Add this sprint into the board/project (via board filter)
# Try to delete/reopen the sprint (via Sprint Report)

*Expected Results:*
The report should show-up the sprint ("Sprint A") with option to reopen it.

*Actual Results:*
Nothing shows up on the report related to this sprint. Even though the sprint is still available on JIRA (search issues page).

*Workaround:*
For JIRA Server, users can manually delete this entry from the database. For Cloud customers, please raise a support ticket with us. 

- Find the sprints you have:
{code:sql}select * from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT";{code}

- Delete the sprint:
{code:sql}DELETE FROM "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" where "ID" = <SPRINT-ID>;{code} 

*Affects Version:*
JIRA SW 7.2.0-OD-05-030
JIRA Agile v7.2.6-D20160330T044439
fields.summary: Unable to delete/reopen orphan sprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-13555].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When an issue is added to a Sprint by populating the 'Sprint Field' during the issue creation, the history is not captured only shows {{$User created issue $date}}. This causes the problem that issue information(issue being added or removed to a Sprint) not being shown in the Burndown Report.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add the field sprint to the default issue creation screen for the project
# During the issue creation, assign it to a sprint
# Remove it from the Sprint
# Check the Burndown Report

h3. Expected Results
History of issue being added/removed from a sprint should be captured. When removing the issue from the sprint, it should also capture the time and date it is removed from the sprint.

h3. Actual Results
History is not captured when it was added to the sprint, therefore causing information about the issue being added/removed from the sprint is not shown in the Burndown Report.

h3.Workaround
Momentarily refrain from assigning to sprint during issue creation. Assign issues to Sprint from *Backlog*.
fields.summary: When the issue is added to a Sprint during issue creation, the issue information is not shown in the Burndown Report

Please add any details that might help us help you.
I am trying to come to grips with the removal of the screenshot menu item in JIRA and have run into a major bug in your implementation.
To reproduce.
1. Create a new issue and attach a screen shot by pasting in the Attachments area, (while in a Kanban board or Sprint board).
2. Go to the issue and use the short cut key "." and choose attach files.
It will bring up the screen 1 in the attachments of this issue.
3. paste in the screenshot again and all works well.
4. while in the board I can go to other issues and attach using the short cut key and pasting.
5. Once I leave the board and go to another board I can no longer paste and see the screen 2.
The same thing happens if I open a board and then try to bring up the attach file screen to paste. I see screen 2.
Help!!!!

P.S. I talked to support and they referred me to;
This is a known issue that we are tracking via the following issue records.
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSW-13115
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-44954
Which don't seem to be the same issue.

So I am generating the bug report here.
fields.summary: JIRA 7.1.2 upgrade and screenshots (attach files) is not working consistantly in Boards.
